main event: Two unidentified flying objects were sighted at Hickam AFB, Hawaii on May 15, 1949, with observations lasting for 5 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were observed to be circular tapering with no tail, and had a tail two to three times as long as their diameter., The objects displayed good maneuverability and were sighted at different altitudes during the observation., They were traveling at speeds in excess of 500 miles per hour heading in a northerly direction., First sighting was at approximately 6,000 to 7,000 feet and the second sighting appeared to dive from 9,000 to 10,000 feet., The objects emitted no sound or exhaust trail during the sighting.
sighted object: two circular tapering objects with a tail
